glosses: bewilderment, confusion, disarray, perplexity, puzzlement, the state of being confused or bewildered
surprise, astonishment, stupefaction, amazement, disbelief, the state of being surprised or stupefied
stupidity, imbecility, unintelligence, stolidness, dumbness, cluelessness, obliviousness, the state or being stupid, imbecile, or dumb

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish شاشقینلق (şaşkınlık). Equivalent to şaşkın (“suprised, bewildered, confused, clueless”) + -lık (-ness).
